content.question:
His lacrimis vitam damus et miserescimus ultro.

Ipse viro primus manicas atque arta levari

vincla iubet Priamus dictisque ita fatur amicis:

"Quisquis es, amissos hinc iam obliviscere Graios

5(noster eris) mihique haec edissere vera roganti:

Quo molem hanc immanis equi statuere? Quis auctor?

Quidve petunt? Quae religio? Aut quae machina belli?"

Aeneid 2. 145-151

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. (A) What are the case and use of lacrimis (line 1) ? (B) Translate it in context with the word that modifies it.

2. Which two Latin words in this passage indicate the prisoner is a stranger to Priam?

3. (A) What are the case and use of haec (line 5) and (B) which one Latin word modifies it?

4. (A) Identify the two imperatives in this passage and (B) translate them in context.

5. In lines 4-7 (Quisquis . . . belli), which two Latin words can be translated “for what reason did they make”?

6. (A) Identify one and only one literary device in line 7 (Quidve . . . belli) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.

7. Later in Book 2, why do the Trojans not listen to the warnings of a woman who tells them not to accept the horse?
